## Package Managers Across Distros {.smaller}

- APT → Debian / Ubuntu / Mint
- DNF → Fedora / RHEL / CentOS Stream
- Pacman → Arch / Manjaro
- Zypper → openSUSE
- Nix → Multi-distro (user or system level)
- Universal: Flatpak / Snap

## Installing & Updating Software

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column}

### Debian/Ubuntu (APT)
```bash
sudo apt update
sudo apt upgrade
sudo apt install <pkg>
```

### Fedora (DNF)
```bash
sudo dnf upgrade --refresh
sudo dnf install <pkg>
```

:::
::: {.column}

### Arch (Pacman)
```bash
sudo pacman -Syu
sudo pacman -S <pkg>
```

### Nix (User env)
```bash
nix profile upgrade --all
nix profile install nixpkgs#<pkg>
```

:::
::::

## What Makes Distros Different?

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column}

- Package manager & dependency model
- Release model (LTS, rolling, point)
- Init system (systemd vs alternatives)
- Target audience & philosophy

:::
::: {.column}

- Default desktop & tooling
- Drivers / hardware enablement cadence
- Community vs corporate governance
- Documentation & support ecosystem

:::
::::

---

### Why Choose One Over the Other?

| Axis              | Favors             | Examples              |
|-------------------|--------------------|-----------------------|
| Stability (LTS)   | Debian/Ubuntu LTS  | Servers, labs         |
| Bleeding edge     | Arch/Fedora        | Kernel / Dev          |
| Reproducibility   | NixOS              | Dev envs, CI          |
| GUI tools         | Ubuntu/Fedora      | Onboarding, classrooms|
| YaST/Config GUI   | openSUSE           | Admin friendliness    |

## “Applications” of Different Distros

- **Servers/Labs** → Debian/Ubuntu LTS, RHEL/CentOS Stream
- **Daily Desktop** → Ubuntu, Fedora, Mint
- **Power Users** → Arch, openSUSE Tumbleweed
- **Reproducible/Dev** → NixOS (or Nix on any distro)
- **Lightweight/Legacy** → Debian + lightweight DE, Arch-based spins

## Why Aren’t You Already on Nix?

- Declarative configs & rollbacks
- Reproducible dev environments
- Works alongside any distro
- Learning curve & mindset shift *(call it out honestly)*
